API documentation¶

Random Forest model¶

In the first part of this module we implement a bayesian optimizer to find the best hyperparameters for an RF algorithm. After that we fit 2 models with the 2 best hyperparameters using a 5 fold TimeSeriesSplit cross validation and we compute the accuracy on training and test set. TimeSeriesSplit is used for 2 reasons: 1) We want to make sure that the models doesn’t look into future data 2) We introduce a gap between test and train in each fold to prevent information leakage

FeatureSelection.rf_model.acc_model(params)¶

This function computes the AUC score of the model on the validation set.

Parameters

params (**kwargs) – paramters for the RF model

Yields

accuracy (float) – AUC score

FeatureSelection.rf_model.func(params)¶

This is the functon we want to minimize during the tuning process.

Parameters

params (**kwargs) – paramters for the RF model

Yields

  • loss (float) – the parameter we want to minimize (-AUC score)

  • status – this parameter reports if an error occured while the model is fitting

  • train_time – time fit the model and compute the AUC score

FeatureSelection.rf_model.time_cv(clf, n_folds, t_size=200000, gap_size=200000)¶

This function train a model with TimeSeriesSplit cross validation.

Parameters

  • clf (classifier) – The classifier we want to fit.

  • n_folds (int) – number of CV splits

  • t_size (int (default 2e5)) – Maximum test size for each CV split

  • gap_size (int (default 2e5)) – Gap between training and test for each split

Yields

score_cv (list of float) – AUC score at each iteration
